member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Media.Media3D.BSPTree.PrimitiveLocation
member.summary: Classifies each point in the second polygon versus the first polygon.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Media.Media3D.BSPTree.PrimitiveLocation.Behind
member.summary: If there are points on the negative side but no points on the positive side, Polygon2 is considered to be behind Polygon1.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Media.Media3D.BSPTree.PrimitiveLocation.Coinciding
member.summary: If all points are coinciding polygon2 is considered to be coinciding with Polygon1.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Media.Media3D.BSPTree.PrimitiveLocation.Infront
member.summary: If there are points on the positive side but no points on the negative side, Polygon2 is considered to be in front of Polygon1.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Media.Media3D.BSPTree.PrimitiveLocation.Spanning
member.summary: The last possible case is that there are points on both the positive and the negative side, then polygon2 is considered to be spanning Polygon1.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Media.Media3D.BSPTree.PrimitiveLocation.Unknown
member.summary: We can't classify primitive location (used with ray tracing only).

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D.SetIdentity
member.summary: Changes this Matrix3D structure into an identity matrix.
member.remarks: In an identity matrix, all coefficients are 0 except the [1,1][2,2][3,3][4,4] coefficients, which are set to 1. The identity matrix is special in that when it is applied to vertices, they are unchanged. The identity matrix is used as the starting point for matrices that modify vertex values to create rotations, translations, and any other transformations that can be represented by a 4x4 matrix.

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this Matrix3D structure is affine.
member.value: True if the Matrix3D structure is affine; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D.IsIdentity
member.summary: Determines whether this Matrix3D structure is an identity Matrix3D.
member.value: True if the Matrix3D structure is an identity Matrix3D; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: In an identity matrix, all coefficients are 0 except the [1,1][2,2][3,3][4,4] coefficients, which are set to 1. The identity matrix is special in that when it is applied to vertices, they are unchanged. The identity matrix is used as the starting point for matrices that modify vertex values to create rotations, translations, and any other transformations that can be represented by a 4x4 matrix.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D
member.summary: Triangle primitive for building a 3-D shape.
member.remarks: MeshGeometry3D allows the developer to specify position, normal, and texture coordinate information. The Positions property is required. Normals are assumed to be associated with the front faces of a mesh primitive. The winding order (the order in which the Positions that make up each triangle of the mesh are specified) determines whether a given face is front-facing or back-facing. Front-facing triangles are wound in counter-clockwise order; back-facing triangles are wound in clockwise order.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.op_Equality(Telerik.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D,Telerik.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D)
member.summary: Compares two Point3D structures for equality.
member.param: The first Point3D structure to compare.
The second Point3D structure to compare.
member.returns: true if the X, Y, and Z values for point1 and point2 are equal; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Two Point3D structures are equal if the values of their X, Y, and Z properties are the same. Because the value of Doubles can lose precision when you perform arithmetic operations on them, a comparison between two Doubles that are logically equal might fail.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Media.Media3D.Quaternion
member.summary: Structure that represents a rotation in three dimensions.
member.remarks: Quaternions allow you to interpolate between rotation transformations applied to an object, thereby making it easier to compute smooth animations of rotations. A quaternion represents an axis of rotation and a rotation around that axis. It's possible to individually define the axis and angle of rotation of the starting and ending positions of a rotated object ,but the intermediate positions of that object during an animation are computationally uncertain. By determining a quaternion that represents the original orientation of a 3-D object and one that represents its destination orientation, you can smoothly interpolate between those orientations.

member.remarks: Rect3D is defined as a location (Point3D) and a size structure (Size3D). Because the X, Y, and Z values specified for the size are magnitudes and not coordinates, they cannot be negative except in the case of an empty rectangle.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Media.Media3D.TrianglePrimitive.ClassifyPolygon(Telerik.Windows.Media.Media3D.TrianglePrimitive)
member.summary: Classifies each point in the other primitive versus this primitive. If there are points on the positive side but no points on the negative side, Other primitive is considered to be in front of This primitive. If there are points on the negative side but no points on the positive side, Other primitive is considered to be behind This primitive. If all points are coinciding Other primitive is considered to be coinciding with This primitive. The last possible case is that there are points on both the positive and the negative side, then Other primitive is considered to be spanning This primitive.
member.returns: Which side of polygon1 polygon 2 is located on.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Charting.BaseAnimationConverter
member.summary:
Represents an that is used in s' animations. This converter serves as a base class for generation of animations delays to acheive effects like "sequential" animations of the items, i.e. each item to begin animating after the previous one's animation has begun or finished.
For more information see and .

member.param: Item whose animations' delay is required.
The type of the binding target property.
The delay that is to be applied for the second item.
The culture to use in the converter.
member.returns: A converted value. If the method returns null, the valid null value is used.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Charting.DelayConverter
member.summary:
Represents an that is used in ChartItems' animations. This converter generates animations delays to enable "sequential" animations of the items, i.e. each item to begin animating after the previous one's animation has begun or finished.
For more information see .

member.summary: Represents the Drill action. It occurs when an item is clicked to drill into its details.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Charting.HierarchyDrillAction.Back
member.summary: Represents the Back action. It occurs when the chart is put in its previous state.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Charting.HierarchyDrillAction.Forward
member.summary: Represents the Forward action. It occurs when the chart is put in the state it has been before Back has occured.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Charting.HierarchyDrillAction.Reset
member.summary: Represents the Reset action. It occurs when the chart is put in its initial state.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Charting.InteractivityScope
member.summary: Determines the level of interactivity processed by the chart control.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Charting.InteractivityScope.None
member.summary: User interactivity is disabled (hover / select effects will not be applied).

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Charting.InteractivityScope.Item
member.summary: User interactivity is processed on series item level (i.e. clicking / hovering an item will select / highlight only the single item).
member.remarks: This enumeration value is not applicable to self-drawing series types like Line, Spline, Area (and all of their derivatives).

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Charting.InteractivityScope.Series
member.summary: User interactivity is processed on series level (i.e. clicking / hovering an item will select / highlight all items in its respective series).
member.remarks: This enumeration value is not applicable to Pie and Doughnut series types.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadChart
member.summary: RadChart is a powerful data visualization control that allows you to display various 2D and 3D chart series types. The control can be easily customized via control templates, provides databinding support, display animations out-of-the-box, and supports one or multiple ChartAreas in order to display multiple categories of data at the same time.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadChart.CreateItemStyleDelegate
member.summary:
Gets or sets a delegate that allows you to generate a new user defined to be applied to a number of chart items.
The delegate accepts four parameters:
First parameter is a instance that represents the chart item that is currently processed. This could be either a derivative of , or a derivative of , or a , or a .
Second parameter is the that would be applied to the respective chart item by default. You can use it to set the Style.BasedOn property of the user defined style you are generating.
Third parameter is the respective associated with the chart item. Note that argument will be null if the chart item is a .
Fourth parameter is the respective associated with the chart item.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadChart.SeriesMappings
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of mappings that defines the relations between the data passed to the chart and the chart series fields (YValue, XValue, etc.) that should be bound to the passed data.
member.remarks: You need to add a separate mapping item for each chart series that you would like to display in the chart control.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadChart.UseDefaultLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the default layout of the charting control should be used.
member.remarks: You should set this property to false if you would like to customize the layout of the control entirely through the Content property of the control. Alternatively you can overwrite the control template and change the default layout there, or use a combination of the default layout (from the template) and layout specified in the Content property of the control.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadChart.InheritanceContextPropagator
member.summary: Gets or sets the inheritance context propagator. This is used to propagate the inheritance context from the chart control to any member of this collection so its binding expressions work properly (i.e. if binding expressions are set for any SeriesMapping / ItemMapping, they will be broken due to the SeriesMapping.GroupBy manipulations in GenerateDataSeries(...) unless the InheritanceContextPropagator is used.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Charting.AxisX.LabelStep
member.summary: Gets or sets the label step.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Charting.AxisX.StepLabelLevelCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of levels (steps) that will be used to distribute the axis item labels.
member.remarks: If you set this property to 2, the first item label will be placed on first level, the second - on second level, the third - on the first level, etc.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Charting.AxisX.StepLabelLevelHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of each step label level (row).

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Charting.AxisX.ShouldScaleStepOnZoom
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the axis step value should be preserved or scaled down whenever zooming action occurs.
member.remarks: The default value is true (i.e. the step will be scaled down). This property is applicable only for scenarios with manual axis range and is generally combined with AxisX.ShouldRoundMinValueOnZoom property in order to achieve constant mapping between series items and axis ticks in zoom / scroll scenarios (set ShouldScaleStepOnZoom = false and ShouldRoundMinValueOnZoom = true).

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Charting.AxisX.ShouldRoundMinValueOnZoom
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the axis MinValue should be rounded or not whenever zooming action occurs.
member.remarks: The default value is false (i.e. it will not be rounded). This property is applicable only for scenarios with manual axis range and is generally combined with AxisX.ShouldRoundMinValueOnZoom property in order to achieve constant mapping between series items and axis ticks in zoom / scroll scenarios (set ShouldScaleStepOnZoom = false and ShouldRoundMinValueOnZoom = true).

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Charting.IRadialSeriesDefinition
member.summary:
Represents an object defining the visual representation of each data series, i.e. the chart type that will be used to visualize the corresponding .
This specific interface is designed for series whose items should be visually distinguished from the rest ot the items (e.g. Doughnut, Pie chart, etc).

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Charting.ChartExtension
member.summary: Provides the base class for the extensibility mechanism supported by RadChart.
member.remarks: The extensibility mechanism implements the IExtensibleObject / IExtension pattern. Each custom extension must inherit from the Telerik.Windows.Controls.Charting.ChartExtension class. You can add custom control extensions on the ChartArea level via the ChartArea.Extensions collection property.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Charting.IChartExtension`1

member.typeparam: The type of the extended object.
